categories: Category:Articles with an excess of redlinks

nodes.text: Star Wars Insider 61

Star Wars Insider 61 is the sixty-first issue of Star Wars Insider magazine. It was released to newsstands on August 6, 2002. This was the final Star Wars Insider issue published by Wizards of the Coast.
Contents
Features
Dig into three more amazing scenes from Attack of the Clones with the Insider's resident archaeologist.
It just wouldn't be Star Wars without the music of John Williams, and George Lucas wouldn't have it any other way.
Indianapolis was bursting at the seams May 3-5 with thousands of Star Wars fans like you. Here's your exclusive report.
Australian actress Rose Byrne (Dormé) relates her once-in-a-lifetime experience on the set of Attack of the Clones.
Mexican actress Veronica Segura (Cordé) struggled with the hardships of working on a Star Wars film—long hours, heavy costumes, and partial scripts—and loved every minute of it.
Brennan Swain and Rob Frisbee not only won The Amazing Race, they walked the sands of Tatooine.
Podracing it ain't, but this year the Force is strong with this planet's most popular sport.
The latest expansion set for the Star Wars Trading Card Game is coming. Here's your first look at all 90 cards in the regular set, with comments from the designers.
Departments
You write 'em, we print 'em, and we've even got the pictures to prove it.
George Lucas at Cannes, the charity premieres, midnight madness, news from the front of the lines, and Star Sightings.
Bobble onto swfan.wizards.com and get your limited edition Star Wars bobblehead figures today.
Judge him by his size, do you? See how the masters at ILM overcome their fear and anger to produce the most amazing Star Wars duel to date.
The Power of the Jedi Sourcebook reveals the secrets of the Jedi order like never before. See what this new resource adds to the Star Wars Roleplaying Game and Expanded Universe lore.
Grim-and-gritty author Matthew Woodring Stover joins the ranks of The New Jedi Order with the release of The New Jedi Order: Traitor. Jacen Solo will never be the same again.
Dark Horse Comics has perfected the art of giving Star Wars fans exactly what they want. In this case, it's a complete reprint of the classic Marvel Comics Star Wars series.
The Cloud City carbon-freezing chamber was one of the most important locations in the entire Star Wars saga.
Of Jedi and Revenge, limited edition "theater" Luke, typos, price guides, Pepsi cans, and the ultimate question: Is "mint, in box" more important than playing with your toys?
It's all a lot of simple tricks and nonsense.
What color is your bloodstripe?
Just when you thought Jawas couldn't get any cuter...
